marketNews.title: China Plans Fiscal Stimulus Without Key Details
marketNews.content:
China's Finance Minister Lan Fo'an appeared to test investors' patience on Saturday (12 Oct) when he announced a plan to release a fiscal stimulus package without disclosing its size. Analysts and investors had previously expected Lan to announce a stimulus worth 2 trillion yuan (US$283 billion) in a briefing at the end of the weekend. Bloomberg reported that details of the stimulus are likely to be announced at the end of October 2024 after review by the National People's Congress.

Although the amount was not disclosed, Lan outlined several fiscal stimulus measures that the Chinese government will roll out soon, including: 
- The central government will issue more bonds to ease debt pressure on local governments, allowing them to focus on supporting their regional economies. 
- Local governments may use funds from special bonds to purchase unsold homes and convert them into subsidised housing. 
- The Ministry of Finance said there is ample room for the central government to increase debt and fiscal deficit. 
- The largest state‑owned banks in China will receive support to replenish their capital, a step taken to ease capital pressure after the People’s Bank of China cut mortgage rates significantly and trimmed its policy rate to revive the economy.

Bloomberg reported that no new consumption‑stimulus incentives were mentioned, nor were any household subsidies detailed.

Following the announcement, equity markets reacted mixed: the Shanghai Composite and the CSI300 Real Estate Index closed up +2.07% and +3.94% respectively on Monday (14 Oct), while the Hang Seng Index fell –0.75%. The yuan weakened 0.18% against the US dollar on the same day.

Lan’s announcement came one day before the National Bureau of Statistics of China released that the consumer price index (CPI) for September 2024 was unchanged month‑on‑month and eased to 0.4% year‑on‑year (vs. August 2024: 0.4% MoM and 0.6% YoY), below consensus expectations of 0.4% MoM and 0.6% YoY. Core CPI was unchanged month‑on‑month and fell to 0.1% YoY (vs. August 2024: 0.4% MoM and 0.3% YoY), the lowest annual reading since February 2021.

Key Takeaway

There are two potential implications of the China stimulus development for Indonesia. From a financial‑market perspective, the attractiveness of the Chinese market to foreign investors could decline if the stimulus size falls short of consensus, potentially reversing the recent foreign outflows from several countries—including Indonesia. From an economic standpoint, successful stimulus that revives the Chinese economy could positively affect Indonesia’s exports of commodities such as coal, CPO, copper and nickel.

*Correction: On Friday (11 Oct), the Stockbit Snips headline mistakenly stated that the construction of 3 million houses per year under the Prabowo administration could raise cement consumption by 60 million tonnes per year (94% of 2023 domestic consumption). The correct estimate is an increase of 6 million tonnes, or 9.4% of 2023 domestic consumption. The error has been corrected on the website.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Coal Production 9M24 Up 0.7% YoY
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s coal production for the first nine months of 2024 rose 0.7% year‑on‑year to 624.16 million tonnes, representing 67.7% of the 2024 RKAB target of 922.14 million tonnes. Based on this realization, Hendra Sinadia, Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association, said that the 2024 coal output will remain below the RKAB target.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo Reports BYD Wholesale Car Sales Decline September 2024
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that wholesale sales of BYD vehicles fell 29% month‑on‑month to 2,075 units in September 2024, reducing BYD’s market share to 2.9% (August 2024: 3.9%). Cumulatively for the first nine months of 2024, BYD’s wholesale sales reached 8,536 units, a 1.3% market share (8M24: 1.2%).

marketNews.title: U.S. Producer Price Index September 2024
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the Producer Price Index (PPI) fell to 1.8% year‑on‑year in September 2024 (August 2024: 1.9% YoY), beating the consensus forecast of 1.6% YoY and marking the lowest level in seven months. The PPI was unchanged month‑on‑month in September (August 2024: 0.2% MoM), below the consensus expectation of 0.1% MoM. Core PPI rose 0.2% MoM in September (August 2024: 0.3% MoM), in line with expectations, and core PPI rose to 2.8% YoY (August 2024: 2.6% YoY), above the consensus 2.7% YoY.

marketNews.title: Prabowo Considers Offering Cabinet Seat to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that President‑elect Prabowo Subianto is considering offering a cabinet seat to the current Finance Minister Sri Mulyani. Sources said Sri Mulyani could remain as Finance Minister or be appointed as Coordinating Minister for the Economy. Neither Sri Mulyani nor Prabowo’s camp commented, and the Finance Ministry declined to comment. Previously, Prabowo said he would likely retain many ministers from President Joko Widodo’s cabinet.

tickerNews.title: ASII Wholesale Car Sales Down 15.2% YoY in 9M24
tickerNews.content: Astra International reported domestic automobile wholesales of 40,096 units (‑9% YoY, ‑5% MoM) in September 2024. The result matched the industry‑wide wholesale car growth, keeping ASII’s market share stable at 55.2% in September 2024 (vs. 55.1% in September 2023 and 55.3% in August 2024). The decline was driven mainly by a 15.5% YoY (‑8.3% MoM) drop in Daihatsu sales to 12,676 units, while Toyota + Lexus sales were 25,591 units (‑2.2% YoY, ‑2.3% MoM). For the first nine months of 2024, ASII’s wholesale car sales fell 15.2% YoY to 357,802 units, with a market share of 56.5% (vs. 55.8% in 9M23).

tickerNews.title: AMMN Potential Copper Concentrate Export Relaxation
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia said the government may again relax copper concentrate export quotas for Amman Mineral International’s subsidiaries PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara and PT Freeport Indonesia. The relaxation would last 1–2 months after the current exemption ends in December 2024, and the quota would equal the volume that cannot be absorbed by the smelters.

tickerNews.title: MDKA Plans Bankable Feasibility Study for Tujuh Bukit Copper Project
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold’s General Manager of Communications, Tom Malik, said the company is preparing a bankable feasibility study for the Tujuh Bukit copper project in Banyuwangi, East Java. The latest March 2024 estimate raised the resource to 8.2 million tonnes of copper (up from 8.1 million) and 27.9 million ounces of gold (up from 27.4 million). Mining will start after the over‑lying gold mine is exhausted in 2029, making Tujuh Bukit the third‑largest copper mine in Indonesia and potentially adding 10–15% to national copper output.

tickerNews.title: PYFA Targets Acquisitions to Boost 2025 Revenue
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma’s management said in a public expose that the company targets acquisitions of other pharmaceutical firms to gain new products and markets. Seven companies are under review – one Indonesian, three Australian, one Filipino, one Myanmar and one Malaysian. The inorganic‑growth strategy is expected to lift revenue by more than 50% YoY in 2025 versus relying solely on organic growth. Previously, PYFA acquired Australian firm Probiotec Limited for AUD 252 million in mid‑2024.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Signs MOU with Pertamina International Shipping for Maritime Cooperation
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific, through its subsidiary PT Chandra Shipping International, signed a memorandum of understanding with PT Pertamina International Shipping to explore a feasibility study for cooperation in chemicals, bitumen and other maritime logistics. The potential partnership aims to improve efficiency and global reach in sea transport and logistics.

tickerNews.title: TKIM Injects IDR 300 Billion into Subsidiary SHJ
tickerNews.content: Tjiwi Kimia announced a capital injection of IDR 300 billion into its subsidiary PT Sumalindo Hutani Jaya (SHJ) to support SHJ’s industrial forest plantation activities.

tickerNews.title: AMAN Chairman Johan Tedja Surya Buys 2.4 Million AMAN Shares
tickerNews.content: Makmur Berkah Amanda’s Chairman and President Director Johan Tedja Surya purchased approximately 2.4 million shares of AMAN at an average price of IDR 109 per share on 8 October 2024, a transaction value of about IDR 265 million. After the purchase, his ownership rose from 4.1% to 4.16%.
